text: <@UM30MT6RF> but I assume there are cases when it is better to use ReverseDiff, right? Despite it being more complex.

elements.text: but I assume there are cases when it is better to use ReverseDiff, right? Despite it being more complex.

text: Yes, as you said above it is useful for differentiating functions wrt a lot of parameters, which is why it's typically used for neural nets, for example.
